info.description: The Performance Management service enables applications to access and create feedback about workers in the system.
info.title: performanceEnablement

tags.name: cascadedGoalEvent
tags.description: Creates and initiates a Cascaded Goal Event instance with specified data allowing cascading of goals to multiple employees which includes Organizations, Employees and/or a Talent Pool.

tags.name: feedbackBadges
tags.description: Provides the ability to get available feedback badges for use in providing feedback.

tags.name: giveRequestedFeedbackEvents
tags.description: Provides the ability to get and update available in progress give requested feedback events that the login user is the responder for. Add the Feedback Responder security group to the domain security policy for the Self-Service: Role Requested Feedback and Self-Service: Self Requested Feedback domains. You must also add the Feedback Responder security group in the business process security policy under the Give Requested Feedback REST initiating action.

tags.name: myPerformanceReviews
tags.description: Provides the ability to initiate a performance review for a worker using the specified data.

tags.name: organizationGoals
tags.description: Provides the ability to create and edit an organization goal for an organization.

tags.name: workerGoalEvents
tags.description:
Provides the ability to manage individual goals outside of a review.

To start and submit a request to manage goals for a specific worker:

1. Initiate a manage goals request by calling the POST /workerGoalEvents method, which returns the new worker goal event ID.

2. Propose goals for the event by calling POST /workerGoalEvents/{eventId}/goals. Provide the required goal name along with other goal fields.

3. Create, edit or delete Goal Milestones for the specified single goal for a given worker goal event ID by calling POST /workerGoalEvents/{eventId}/milestone, PATCH /workerGoalEvents/{eventId}/milestone/{milestoneId} or DELETE /workerGoalEvents/{eventId}/milestone/{milestoneId} respectively and providing the required Goal for Milestone and Milestone name along with other fields.
 
4. Submit the manage goals request by calling the POST /workerGoalEvents/{ID}/submit endpoint. The updated data in the preceding goals POST requests do not persist until you call POST /workerGoalEvents/{ID}/submit.

tags.name: Prompt Values
tags.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of active Feedback Badges.
get.description: Retrieves all active Feedback Badges. Secured by: Give Feedback Scope: Performance Enablement, Worker Profile and Skills

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of goals for a specific worker.
get.description: Retrieves all goals for a worker with the specified ID. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service. The goal data includes name, description, category, tags, associated reviews, due date, completed date, status, creator, worker it is for, supporting organization goal, locked reason, and activity streamable item. Secured by: Self-Service: Employee Goals, Worker Data: Employee Goals Scope: Performance Enablement

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Creates a single self-requested feedback event instance for the specified worker.
post.description: Creates a single self-requested feedback event instance for the specified worker with the provided data. Workday specifies the worker by Workday ID. You can use a returned ID from GET /workers in the Staffing service. To see the status of conditionally hidden attributes for this request, call this method with the wd-metadata-api-version header. Set the header value to v1 (or the latest Workday Metadata API version). When you specify the wd-metadata-api-version header, this method returns the response metadata, instead of the actual data. This endpoint is equivalent to the Get Feedback on Self task in Workday. It initiates the Give Feedback business process. Secured by: Get Feedback on Self REST Scope: Performance Enablement, Worker Profile and Skills

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A6 | Specify a valid template ID for Feedback Template or add at least 1 ad-hoc question under Feedback Questions.
A6 | Specify a value in the Question field under Feedback Questions.
A161 | Specify a Feedback on Self template type ID for Feedback Template.
A161 | Specify a valid talent tag ID for the Relates To field.
A161 | Terminated workers can't provide feedback. Specify 1 or more active worker IDs for Feedback Responders.
A161 | Workers on leave can't provide feedback. Specify 1 or more active worker IDs for Feedback Responders.
A161 | You can't add additional ad-hoc questions with a locked feedback template.
A161 | You can't specify a worker that's the same as the worker requesting feedback. Specify 1 or more unique worker IDs for Feedback Responders.
A161 | You can't specify an inactive feedback template. Specify an active template ID for Feedback Template.
A161 | You can't specify workers who don't have permission to give requested feedback. Specify 1 or more worker IDs for Feedback Responders that have permission to give requested feedback.
A165 | The attachment category is invalid for this business process.
A175 | The file is required.
A178 | The business process has already been initiated.
A200 | You can't comment on this business process type.
A205 | You don't have the security permission on this business process to add attachments.
A206 | Attachments are not enabled for this business process.

A211 | The attachment category is required.
A219 | The business process action isn't valid.
A221 | The attachment category isn't enabled for this business process.
A228 | [customer event validation message]

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of \~development items\~ for the specified \~worker\~.
get.description: Retrieves all \~development items\~ for a \~worker\~ with the specified ID. The \~development item\~ data includes the name, additional information, status, status note text, creator, \~worker\~ who last updated the \~development item\~, the localized date the \~development item\~ was created, started, and completed, the localized date and time the \~development item\~ was last updated, whether the \~development item\~ is in review, and the tenanted attributes the \~development item\~ is related to, including \~competency\~, job profile, work experience, and job interest. Secured by: Self-Service: Development Items, Worker Data: Development Items Scope: Career and Development Planning, Performance Enablement

Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Creates a single requested feedback event instance for the specified worker.

You can use a returned ID from GET/workers in the Staffing service. To see the status of conditionally hidden attributes for this request, call this method with the wd-metadata-api-version header. Set the header value to v1 (or the latest Workday Metadata API version). When you specify the wd-metadata-api-version header, this method returns the response metadata, instead of the actual data. This endpoint is equivalent to the Get Feedback on Worker task in Workday. It initiates the Give Feedback business process. post.summary: Creates a single goal instance with the specified data.
post.description: Creates a single goal instance, initiated by the Manage Goals business process. A Worker Goal event must be initiated using the POST /workerGoalEvents operation prior to submitting this request. In the request body, specify the required goalName field. It can also initiate the review and approval process based on your business process configuration. This operation is equivalent to accessing the Manage Goals task from the Manage Goals button on the My Goals task. Secured by: Self-Service: Employee Goals, Worker Data: Employee Goals Scope: Performance Enablement

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

post.summary: Creates a single performance review instance with the specified data.
post.description: Creates a single performance review instance with the specified data. In the request body, specify the review template and the review period start and end dates. Start My Performance Review is the equivalent UI task. Secured by: Start My \~Performance Review\~ (REST Service) Scope: Performance Enablement

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A165 | The attachment category is invalid for this business process.
A175 | The file is required.
A178 | The business process has already been initiated.
A200 | You can't comment on this business process type.
A205 | You don't have the security permission on this business process to add attachments.
A206 | Attachments are not enabled for this business process.
A207 | You've exceeded the attachment file size limit of [tenant setup attachment limit]KB.
A211 | The attachment category is required.
A219 | The business process action isn't valid.
A221 | The attachment category isn't enabled for this business process.
A228 | [customer event validation message]
A3040 | This \~employee\~ doesn't have the correct domain to take \~employee\~ \~reviews\~. Provide domain access  to the \~employee\~ to run this service.
A3041 | A \~performance review\~ already exists for the specified \~employee\~ using the \~review\~ type and period dates. Specify a \~review\~ template with a different \~review\~ type or change the period dates of the specified \~performance review\~.
A3041 | You can't start a new \~review\~ because there is a \~review\~ still in progress with contents that need to be carried over to the new \~review\~. Complete the first \~review\~ before proceeding.
A3041 | You can't start a new \~review\~ because there is a \~review\~ still in progress with contents that need to be consolidated into the new \~review\~. Complete the first \~review\~ before proceeding.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of workers and current staffing information.
get.description: Retrieves a collection of workers and current staffing information. Secured by: FLW Service, Self-Service: Current Staffing Information, Worker Data: Public Worker Reports Scope: Staffing

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service. Secured by: Self-Service: Employee Goals, Worker Data: Employee Goals Scope: Performance Enablement

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of feedback given events about the specified worker.
get.description: Retrieves all feedback given events about the specified worker. Could also return a feedback multiple recipient event. This endpoint is equivalent to the View Feedback task in Workday. Secured by: Self-Service: Anytime Feedback, Worker Data: Anytime Feedback Scope: Performance Enablement, Worker Profile and Skills

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Creates a single feedback given event instance about the specified worker.
post.description: Creates a single instance of feedback for each of the specified workers with the provided data. The worker is specified by the Workday ID of the worker. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service /staffing. If you want to see the status of conditionally hidden attributes for this request, call this method with the wd-metadata-api-version header. Set the header value to v1 (or the latest Workday Metadata API version). When you specify the wd-metadata-api-version header, this method returns the response metadata, instead of the actual data. This endpoint is equivalent to the Give Feedback task in Workday. This endpoint initiates the Give Feedback business process or the Give Feedback to Multiple Recipients business process based on the request. Secured by: Give Feedback Scope: Performance Enablement, Worker Profile and Skills

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A6 | Comment is required.
A158 | You cannot notify these workers because notifications are not enabled at your company.
A159 | Your feedback cant be both Confidential and Private.
A160 | You do not have permission to give feedback to the specified workers.
A160 | You don't have permission to give feedback on this \~flex team\~.
A161 | Feedback cannot be provided to terminated workers.
A161 | Feedback given to multiple recipients cannot be anonymous.
A161 | Feedback given to multiple recipients cannot be confidential.
A161 | Feedback given to multiple recipients cannot be private.
A161 | The Feedback Given Date cannot be in the future.
A161 | Worker giving the feedback cannot be the same as the worker receiving the feedback.
A161 | You can only notify people when the feedback is not anonymous, not confidential, and not private.
A161 | You can't give feedback for this \~worker\~ because they already have feedback.
A161 | You can't give feedback for this \~worker\~ because they're not a member of this \~flex team\~.
A161 | You can't load an inactive badge.
A161 | You cannot notify [workers] as they are also the feedback recipients.
A161 | You cannot notify [workers] because theyre not enabled for feedback.
A165 | The attachment category is invalid for this business process.
A175 | The file is required.
A178 | The business process has already been initiated.
A200 | You can't comment on this business process type.
A205 | You don't have the security permission on this business process to add attachments.
A206 | Attachments are not enabled for this business process.
A207 | You've exceeded the attachment file size limit of [tenant setup attachment limit]KB.
A211 | The attachment category is required.
A219 | The business process action isn't valid.
A221 | The attachment category isn't enabled for this business process.
A228 | [customer event validation message]

location_b8ac205877fd10000ea91737c7da00a.description: The location associated with the filled position or position restrictions. jobType_b8ac205877fd10000ea91752f39c00ab.description: The position's job type which can be one of the following values: Primary, Additional Job, or International Assignment. If the position is not effective, no value will be returned. Primary and additional job are effective dated due to the Switch Primary Job business process. An international assignment cannot be switched to a be a primary job.
